text.text: Dilophosaurus, a large theropod from North America. This large dinosaur is a fierce creature that would've been an early top predator. First confirmed discovery in 1940, described in 1954, the Dilophosaurus got a face-lift in early 2020, with a more correct frill.
Dilophosaurus was 7 meters from nose to tail. It would've hunted down large game, and would be a mighty fow, thought it was solitary.
